programme.title: Club TV Special
programme.desc: Hem werd een grote toekomst bij PSV voorspeld, maar drie dagen na het uitbreken van de Tweede Wereldoorlog sneuvelde Johan Brusselers op 21-jarige leeftijd bij de gevechten op de Grebbeberg. PSV TV gaat op zoek naar het verhaal van de onbekende soldaat, de enige selectiespeler van PSV die de oorlog niet overleefde.

programme.title: ESPN DOC
programme.desc: In de zomer van 1991 werd de jongensdroom van Darije Kalezić werkelijkheid toen hij bij Velež Mostar tekende. Een paar maanden later spatte die droom ruw uiteen toen Joegoslavië uit elkaar viel en Bosnië het toneel werd van etnische zuiveringen.

programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Practice
programme.desc: IndyCar drivers learn the particulars of the track and communicate to their crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency during the upcoming race in Alabama; crews work to set up the car.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Qualifications
programme.desc: IndyCar drivers aim for the best starting spot in the upcoming race, and the driver with the fastest time is awarded pole position; Scott McLaughlin averaged 125.552 mph to win the pole last year before winning the race over Will Power.

programme.title: Indycar INXT Qualifications
programme.desc: NXT drivers aim for the best starting position in the upcoming race in Alabama, and the driver with the fastest time is awarded the pole position on the front row of the starting grid; the second-fastest time starts outside the pole sitter.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: San Diego is coming off of a 3-1 defeat to Real Salt Lake on April 26 with their lone goal of the match scored by Hirving Lozano from the penalty spot; Dallas claimed a 4-3 victory against Inter Miami on April 27, led by a Pedrinho goal and assist.

programme.title: Indycar INXT Racing
programme.desc: Rookie Dennis Hauger gained an early 14-point lead in the standings over Lochie Hughes after a dominant win at St. Petersburg in the opener; Jacob Abel won the race at Barber last year over Nolan Siegel en route to finishing the season as runner-up.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Austin Cindric secured his first win of the season with a win at Talladega over Kyle Larson, while William Byron leads the standings; Chase Elliott averaged 116.492 mph en route to his win at Texas last year, beating Brad Keselowski under caution.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The most talented bowlers in the world compete for lucrative prize money and coveted trophies, challenged by various lane oil patterns throughout the season, requiring bowlers to adjust ball angle, rotation and speed in order to succeed.

programme.title: NASCAR RaceDay
programme.desc: RaceDay previews the Wurth 400 and Austin Cindric, who comes off his first win of the season with a win at Talladega, going over the latest news from pit road and updated track conditions, along with their predictions on who wins.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Players and teams compete in the seventh event of 2025 for a $25 million purse; Joaquin Niemann won the individual title with a three-shot victory over Lucas Herbert, while Legion XIII won the team crown in the sixth event in Mexico City on April 27.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Los Angeles swept a three-game series with the Braves at Dodger Stadium earlier this season, outscoring Atlanta in the three games, 15-7; Atlanta split a four-game series with the Dodgers at Truist Park last year.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Austin Cindric secured his first win of the season with a win at Talladega over Kyle Larson, while William Byron leads the standings; Chase Elliott averaged 116.492 mph en route to his win at Texas last year, beating Brad Keselowski under caution.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: San Antonio (1-4) comes off a 27-3 loss to Houston after beating DC, 24-18, but won its meeting with the Stallions last season, 18-9; Birmingham (3-2) had its three-game win streak snapped by Memphis, 24-20, despite two TDs from Case Cookus.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Racing
programme.desc: Kyle Kirkwood moved into second place and cut his deficit to two-time defending champion Alex Palou to 34 points after winning at Long Beach; Scott McLaughlin won the last two races at Birmingham after averaging 106.38 mph last year.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: Pro Volleyball Federation
programme.desc: Omaha claimed victories against Grand Rapids in their first three meetings of the season, winning the most recent matchup on April 17 with a 3-0 scoreline; Brooke Nuneviller and Cooper Reaggan both had 10 kills for the Supernovas in the win.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Tyler Ankrum secured his first Truck Series win since 2019 with his victory at Rockingham over Jake Garcia; Kyle Busch averaged 118.471 mph en route to his win at Texas last year, defeating current points leader Corey Heim by 0.112 seconds.

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: Kentucky Derby Preview
programme.desc: Analysts preview the upcoming running of the Kentucky Derby, the first of the three Triple Crown races, breaking down the morning-line favorites for the race, recent performances from the horses in the race and their predictions on who wins.

programme.title: Women's Coupe de France
programme.desc: Paris FC and Paris Saint-Germain played to draws in both of their meetings from the league season with the final matchup on March 15 ending in a goalless scoreline; Paris SG keeper Mary Earps recorded 5 saves and 11 accurate long balls in the draw.

programme.title: Women's College Lacrosse
programme.desc: Villanova (11-6) defeated UConn, 16-10, in the semifinals; No. 21 Denver (13-5) has won all 13 meetings with the Wildcats after a 17-7 win on April 26 behind five goals and two assists from Raegan Wilson, along with five points from Eva Thomsen-Marr.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: Carlton (3-4-0) has won three in a row after defeating Geelong, 94-76, in Round 7; Adelaide (4-3-0) has won the past three encounters vs. the Blues, including a 100-98 triumph at Marvel Stadium last season, as the Crows booted the final three goals.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: Geelong (4-3-0) won last season's encounter against the Magpies with a 91-71 victory at MCG, as Patrick Dangerfield finished with 22 disposals and six clearances; Collingwood (6-1-0) has won six in a row after defeating Essendon, 107-66, in Round 7.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: Port Adelaide (4-3-0) has won the past four meetings with the Bulldogs, including a 102-54 victory last season, as Connor Rozee had 36 touches, seven clearances and a goal; Western (4-3-0) has won two-straight after defeating GWS, 113-81, in Round 7.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: Teams composed of players represented by bowling ball parent sponsors Brunswick (four teams), Storm (three teams) and independent brand MOTIV (one team) compete in the final event of the season with the winning team earning a $100,000 top prize.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The most talented bowlers in the world compete for lucrative prize money and coveted trophies, challenged by various lane oil patterns throughout the season, requiring bowlers to adjust ball angle, rotation and speed in order to succeed.

programme.title: Pro Volleyball Federation
programme.desc: Omaha claimed victories against Grand Rapids in their first three meetings of the season, winning the most recent matchup on April 17 with a 3-0 scoreline; Brooke Nuneviller and Cooper Reaggan both had 10 kills for the Supernovas in the win.

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: FIFA Beach Soccer World Cup
programme.desc: Seychelles comes off of a 6-3 defeat to Belarus on matchday 1 with goals scored by Remy De Ketelaere, Brandon Labrosse and Terrence Amade; Guatemala lost to Japan to open their tournament, 6-2, with Berny Marroquin and Miguel Angel Gonzalez strikes.

programme.title: FIFA Beach Soccer World Cup
programme.desc: Mauritania is coming off of a 5-4 defeat to Iran on matchday 1, led by a Cheikh Belkheir hat-trick; Portugal claimed an 11-9 victory against Paraguay to open their tournament where Miguel Pintado and Bê Martins found the net with hat-tricks.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: Nashville claimed a 2-0 victory against Atlanta United in their most recent meeting on Sept. 14 through goals from Alex Muyl and Hany Mukhtar; Sam Surridge and Teal Bunbury provided the assists for Nashville in the win away from home.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: Richmond (2-5-0) comes off an 83-63 loss to Melbourne on April 24; Hawthorn (5-2-0) won both encounters against the Tigers last season, including a 131-68 victory in Round 23, as the Hawks scored seven goals in the match's first 11 minutes.

programme.title: STIHL Timbersports Series
programme.desc: Competitive lumberjacks oppose each other in various disciplines based on traditional logging skills in an effort to determine the best all-around lumberjack; Hot Saw, Single Buck, Springboard Chop, Standing Block Chop, Stock Saw and Underhand Chop.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Arlington (3-2) defeated the Battlehawks, 30-15, on April 19 behind 149 passing yards and a touchdown from Luis Perez and a rushing TD from Dae Dae Hunter; St. Louis (3-2) is 2-1 at home after a 32-27 win over Michigan on April 26.

programme.title: Women's College Lacrosse
programme.desc: Villanova (11-6) defeated UConn, 16-10, in the semifinals; No. 21 Denver (13-5) has won all 13 meetings with the Wildcats after a 17-7 win on April 26 behind five goals and two assists from Raegan Wilson, along with five points from Eva Thomsen-Marr.

PGA Tour Champions Highlights
programme.desc: Highlights from the Mitsubishi Electric Classic, a PGA Tour Champions event held at TPC Sugarloaf in Georgia. 2006 Players Championship winner Stephen Ames claimed victory last season.

programme.title: Byron Nelson 2018 Highlights
programme.desc: The 2018 AT&T Byron Nelson, held at Trinity Forest Golf Club in Dallas. This is a leading fundraiser for charity on the PGA Tour.

programme.title: Playing Lessons: Patty Tavatanakit
programme.desc: Former and current pros take viewers behind the ropes on the course, discussing such things as shot setup, club selection, and strategy. Here, Patty Tavatanakit leads the lesson.

programme.title: Playing Lessons: Kamaiu Johnson
programme.desc: With multiple wins on the APGA Tour, Kamaiu Johnson joins Bones on the course to share his tips and strategies for optimum success.

programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the 2024 CJ Cup Byron Nelson, held at TPC Craig Ranch in McKinney, Texas. Former world number one Jason Day emerged victorious a year ago.

programme.title: DP World Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the Hainan Classic, a new DP World Tour event for 2025 held at Mission Hills Resort Haikou in China.

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: Day two of the CJ Cup Byron Nelson, a PGA Tour event previously won by Canada's Taylor Pendrith. A near-perfect Thursday for Scottie Scheffler saw the two-time Major winner claim the lead.

programme.title: LPGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: The second day of the LPGA Tour's Black Desert Championship. 2025 marks the inaugural edition of this event, taking place in Ivins, Utah.

programme.title: Live PGA Tour Golf
